span.strong: Nixa High School Summer School Information

p.span: Nixa High School has decided summer school in June will be completely virtual. If you have previously registered for a seated class, you will automatically be put in the virtual class you registered for unless you contact us at

indicating that you do not wish to participate in virtual summer school. The district will also be looking at another session of summer school in July that potentially will be seated and information will be sent out about at a later date.

The drivers education seated portion will be offered virtually the first 10 days of summer school with the intention to have the driving portion to start at late June early July. This is subject to local healthy department/governmental restrictions. If you have any questions please contact Dianna Hartsell at
The grades for summer school are the ones the student will be in for the 2020-21 school year.
To register for JUNE virtual summer school pleaseclick here
To see virtual JUNE offerings/course descriptions please use the links below:

span.strong: Back to School Bash Sign-Up Information

p.span: Use the form below to sign up for the 2020 Nixa Back to School Bash on Saturday, August 15 at Nixa Junior High from 8:00 a.m.-4:00 p.m.

Students attending the bash will receive basic school supplies as well as other services and items that we can provide. You will receive the full list of what will be provided at a later date so that you can plan accordingly.
Upon submission of this form, you will be contacted between June 1-12 with an appointment time for this day and a link to submit the size preferences for your child (children).

The bash is open to those going into kindergarten through 12th grade at Nixa Public Schools. Depending on the amount of donations provided, we may open this up to those in our Early Childhood Program. We will contact those enrolled at a later date if that is possible.
All children below 6th grade attending the Back to School Bash must be accompanied by an adult.

span.strong: Senior Signs Benefiting Project Graduation

p.span: This has been a year that has had a major impact on our students, especially our senior class. While we see what plans for graduation will look like, we wanted to give you a chance to show your support to seniors by getting a yard sign honoring them.

You can order your yard sign (pictured above) by May 8 and then watch for the message on how you can pick up your sign in Nixa once they are printed. Thank you to 24 Hour Signs in Nixa for printing them.
Proceeds benefit Project Graduation.

span.strong: Blood Drive Monday: Sign-Up Today

hr.div: Nixa Public Schools, City of Nixa, and Nixa Area Chamber of Commerce will be holding a Nixa community-wide blood drive April 27 in the FEMA shelter at John Thomas School of Discovery.
We are encouraging as many donors as possible to aide in our local area hospitals through theCommunity Blood Center of the Ozarks.
Appointments are strongly encouraged to manage donor flow and allow for social distancing.

a.aria-label: Book Appointment Here - Opens a new window

span.strong: Help Us Thank Our Employees

p.span: Normally in May, we thank our teachers, speech therapists, OT/PT staff, process coordinators, librarians & library workers, paraprofessionals, Parents As Teachers staff, & nurses in person at school. However, the current situation prevents us from doing that. So, we need your help. Please take a photo and write up a short description thanking one or all of these staff members and how they impact your lives or why you are thankful for them. It doesn't have to be one of the groups listed above either. Just anyone in the district who has made an impact on your life or who you are thankful for. We will take the month of May to publish these so we can really show how much these people mean to us. Please email your picture and write up to
by Friday, May 1, to be included in this celebration.

span.strong: Library Books
Parents of students leaving the district

p.span: Only if your student is leaving the district, we ask that you please contact your childs school to set an appointment to drop off library books or any other classroom books. Appointments will need to be made between the hours of 9:00 am-2:00 pm.

Chromebooks and chargers can also be returned at that time or may be returned in the media drop box on the east of the Tech Center Building (301 S. Main St.) behind Faught Administration Center. At this time, there is no drop box for standard books, please return those to your childs building by appointment.

span.strong: All other students

p.span: Nixa librarians ask all students remaining in the district to read your books and place them in a safe location for when we are able to have a plan to return them to the buildings. Students will be asked to turn in any library or classroom books at a future time when buildings will be available to pick up personal items. Those plans are being discussed and will be shared in the near future.
NOTE: NO late fees will be charged on books for this closed period.

span.strong: Do You Have A Kindergarten Student For The Fall of 2020?

p.span: If you have a student who will be in kindergarten in the fall of 2020, you need to make sure that you have registered the student for kindergarten online at
ASAP. We need to finalize as many students as possible so we can begin the planning process for the fall.

span.strong: K-6 Student Interest in Virtual and Seated Summer School

em.span: If you haven't filled out this survey, please do so. Also, this is only for students currently in K-6th grade. We are currently looking at summer options for those going into kindergarten in the fall, but need to finalize other plans first.

p.span: Survey: If your child is
and interested in virtual and/or seated classes in June and July, please fill out this
by Thursday, April 23.
Faculty and staff are working hard to provide appropriate learning opportunities for our students. Since this is new territory for all of us, please take a few moments to fill out this

a.aria-label: short survey - Opens a new window

p.span: that will allow us to make adjustments as needed.

span.strong: K-6 Student Interest in Virtual and Seated Summer School

p.strong: If your child iscurrently in grades K-6and interested in virtual and/or seated classes in June and July, please fill out thisinterest surveyby Thursday, April 23.

span.strong: XLT Summer Plans:

p.span: We are currently exploring what programs will be offered this summer through XLT. This will all depend on what guidelines the state releases. Look for information regarding summer XLT programs on Tuesday, May 5, in the parent update email and app notification.

span.strong: Teacher of the Year Announcement: Wednesday at noon

p.span: Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, we will be unable to announce our Teacher of the Year in person. Instead, we will announce it live on Facebook on Wednesday, April 22 at noon. To view the video as we announce it or after the announcement has been made, you can go to ourFacebook page.

span.strong: Lunch Account Balances:

p.span: If you would like to have your lunch account balance refunded because your child will not be attending Nixa next year, please email
. This is also who you would contact if you would like to transfer to another child or donate the money.

span.strong: Do You Have A Kindergarten Student For The Fall of 2020?

p.span: If you have a student who will be in kindergarten in the fall of 2020, you need to make sure that you have registered the student for kindergarten online at
ASAP. We need to finalize as many students as possible so we can begin the planning process for the fall.

hr.p: We have developed a couple of options to show your community support with Nixa Strong shirts. Proceeds from these shirts will go to benefit the Back to School Bash in August since more families will need assistance with back to school items after so many have lost their jobs or have been laid off.
This store closes at 11:59pm on Friday May 1st, 2020.

p.span: Nixa Public Schools, City of Nixa, and Nixa Area Chamber of Commerce will be holding a Nixa community-wide blood drive on April 27 in the FEMA shelter at John Thomas School of Discovery.
We are encouraging as many donors as possible to aide in our local area hospitals through the Community Blood Center of the Ozarks.
Appointments are strongly encouraged to manage donor flow and allow for social distancing.

hr.div: Support project graduation and our seniors by getting their senior shirt.

div.a: Click HERE to purchase a shirt.

hr.div: Deadline to order is Sunday, April 19.

span.strong: Get a senior sign:

hr.div: This has been a year that has had a major impact on our students, especially our senior class.While we see what plans for graduation will look like, we wanted to give you a chance to show your support to seniors by getting a yard sign honoring them.
You can order your yard sign by April 21 and then watch for the message on how you can pick up your sign in Nixa once they are shipped to us.
There are multiple options so you can recognize your senior, add his/her name, or just get a congratulations sign for the class of 2020 if you don't have a senior.Let's paint the town red and gray!
$5 from each sign will go to Care to Learn Nixa to help with the expanded role they will have to support our students through the COVID-19 response this school year and into the next one.
Go tohttp://www.crackerjackshack.com/nixaseniors/to get your sign ordered. Reminder: Deadline is April 21 (Tuesday)

img.title: blood
img.style: display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;

div.span: Nixa Public Schools, City of Nixa, and Nixa Area Chamber of Commerce will be holding a Nixa community-wide blood drive April 27 in the FEMA shelter at John Thomas School of Discovery.
We are encouraging as many donors as possible to aide in our local area hospitals through the
div.a: Community Blood Center of the Ozarks.

div.span: Appointments are strongly encouraged to manage donor flow and allow for social distancing.

img.title: stay home
img.style: display: block; margin-left: auto; margin-right: auto;

p.span: With the addition of three more cases of COVID-19 in Christian County, the Christian County Health Department advises people to refrain from making unnecessary trips to businesses or other areas that are allowed trips. Multiple trips mean multiple chances to spread the COVID 19 virus. Consolidate trips to the grocery store, gas stations or other areas, this helps both you and those you might be unknowingly infecting in the event that you or those you are temporarily sharing a space with have contracted the virus, but arent seeing symptoms yet. Sometimes we assume someone near us is safe because they dont look or act sick. Please do not make these assumptions. Very few of our cases knew they were being exposed at the time they initially contracted the virus. It is temporarily a whole new approach for a close-knit community to live by. Yet it is of utmost importance for each of us to be a part of the solution to this unwanted situation. Protect yourself, and protect those around you.

span.strong: XLT Summer Plans

p.span: We are currently exploring what programs will be offered this summer through XLT. This will all depend on what guidelines the state releases. Look for information regarding summer XLT programs on Tuesday, May 5, in the parent update email and app notification.

span.strong: K-6 Student Interest in Virtual and Seated Summer School

div.p: If your child iscurrently in grades K-6and interested in virtual and/or seated classes in June and July, please fill out thisinterest surveyby Thursday, April 23.

span.strong: Do You Have A Kindergarten Student For The Fall of 2020?

p.span: If you have a student who will be in kindergarten in the fall of 2020, you need to make sure that you have registered the student for kindergarten online at
ASAP. We need to finalize as many students as possible so we can begin the planning process for the fall.
The last day of school will be May 22 for all schools aside from JTSD.
JTSD's last day of school will be June 19.
We are happy to announce three options for our senior graduation:

li.span: Friday, June 16 at 6:30 p.m. at James River Church
Friday, June26 at 6:30 p.m. at James River Church

p.strong: (All grades will be the grade level the student will be in for the 2020-21 school year)

As we finish out the 19-20 school year virtually, it is important to note that summer school will be a beneficial extension to our school year learning. We want students to be caught up with all grade level essential learning, which can be supported by attending our summer school opportunities. Starting the 20-21 school year on track is our goal for your child.
Summer school will be split into two sessions:

ul.li: Session 1 (virtual only): June 1st-25th:1st-12th Grade Online NPS Summer School Offerings

Session 2 (traditional with virtual as backup) July 7th-31st: If possible- Seated Summer School K-12.
1st-6th online NPS offerings available
Launch virtual course offerings for 7th-12th grades.

h1.aria-label: When Can I Pick Up My Stuff?
h1.span: When Can I Pick Up My Stuff?

p.span: Due to the recent announcement that the remainder of the school year will be taught online using alternative methods of instruction, we are working as a district to determine the best way for families to obtain any items that remain in classrooms and lockers. This will be determined at the building level while abiding by the current health safety recommendations. We are sorry for the inconvenience and appreciate your patience as these logistics are being worked out. Building principals will be communicating details soon once we find out if the Stay At Home order will be extended in any way.

For seniors, the high school will be planning a graduation announcement & cap/gown pick-up the first week of May. We will also be doing a Chromebook drop-off at the same time. This is all dependent on the ending of the Stay at Home order. Once that has ended, we will communicate our final details.

If you are unexpectedly moving out of the Nixa or have a planned move out of the district during the remainder of the school year, you will need to turn in your Chromebook and charger. There are two options that you can choose from to turn in your device.

li.span: Until May 22, you may turn in your device at your childs school office between 9:00 a.m. - 2:00 p.m. Monday through Thursday.
There is also a device drop-box located on the east side of the Tech Center located directly behind Faught Administrative Building (297 S. Main St.) available 24 hours a day.

p.span: If you have library books that need to be returned or fines that need to be paid, information on that will come in the next few weeks. Returning items will need to be done once the "Stay At Home" order is lifted.

Any student needing support for their district-provided Chromebook and charger will simply need to notify their teacher. Students in grades 7-12 can notify any of their teachers to initiate the support process. Teachers are only serving as the initial point of contact, as they will work with building Media Aides who will then contact the parent/student to begin the support process with them.

li.span: K-6th grade Chromebooks will have internet access from 7:00 a.m. - 8:00 p.m.
7th-8th grade Chromebooks will have internet access from 6:00 a.m. - 11:00 p.m.
9th-12th grade Chromebooks will have 24 hour access to the internet.

p.span: A lost or stolen device should be reported immediately tosarahknight@nixaschools.net.

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });
$(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

span.span: Under the long-term school closure resulting from the Spring 2020 Coronavirus Pandemic (Covid-19), NPS has taken steps to ensure that learning continues for students and staff in impacted buildings. This guide is a living document and will be updated with new information as it becomes available. Please see the information below for a set of general instructional guidelines and teacher/staff expectations.

p.span: Principal will work with teachers and therapists to develop packets for alternative learning methods. Parents will be able to access online materials. Other digital resources will be shared as available.

Grade level teams, coaches, and principals, in collaboration with Special Services, have assembled and published a set of learning packets, which are available in .pdf format. Parents will be able to access and print packets for each grade level K-2 as well as a set of activities for PE, Art, and Music. Paper copies will be made available for pickup in a centralized location, upon request by families.
Other digital resources will be deployed.

Grade level teams, coaches, and principals, in collaboration with Special Services, have assembled and published a set of learning packets, which are available in .pdf format. Parents and students will be able to access online learning via Canvas on chromebooks for each grade level 3-6 as well as a set of lessons for PE, Art, and Music. Paper copies will be made available for pickup in a centralized location, upon request by families.
Other digital resources will be deployed.

The junior high and high school department, in collaboration with Special Services, have previously created Canvas courses accessible by students. This is where teachers will post instructional materials like notes/updates, lessons, activities, assignments, and hyperdocs to advance student learning.

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });
$(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

h1.aria-label: Internet Access and or Paper - List of Providers
h1.span: Internet Access and or Paper - List of Providers

p.span: There are many companies that are offering internet access services to those affected by Covid-19. However, some of these services require pre-qualifications. One of these pre-qualifications will be applying for and approval of the free/reduced lunch application which can be found here:

br.span: To find the full list of businesses that are offering low-cost internet,see below.

span.strong: What about internet access or paper?

p.span: There are many companies that are offering internet access services to those affected by Covid-19. However, some of these services require pre-qualifications. One of these pre-qualifications will be applying for and approval of the free/reduced lunch application which can be found here:

br.span: free for 60 days, where available, to any household in our service area that has a student from K-12 and/or college.

p.span: This special Suddenlink service is for students who are displaced due to school closures and who dont have Internet access at home.

After your first 60 free days of Internet service expires, those affected can either cancel the service or keep it as a regular paying Altice Advantage Internet customer at the low rate of only $14.99 per month, with no annual contract.

Attached, you will find extensive information related to the offer, including qualifications, terms and how to apply for the services. If you have any questions or concerns you may call Suddenlink directly at 1-888-633-0030.
Click here to view the PDF.

span.br: All AT&T consumer home internet wireline customers, as well as Fixed Wireless Internet, can use unlimited internet data. Additionally, we will continue to offer internet access for qualifying limited income households at $10 per month through our

p.span: program. Weve expanded eligibility to
to households participating in the National School Lunch Program and Head Start. Additionally, were offering new Access from AT&T customers two months of free service.
For more information visit,
Offering Free Install when you go to: https://totalhighspeed.com/customers/signup
When entering your information, make sure in the Additional Information section, enter "Nixa Schools" to receive a free install

br.span: Some fees are waived, learn more at

p.span: For local stores, seeFLYER attached.
Free wifi for low-income families. Read more here: https://corporate.comcast.com/covid-19

Low-income families participating in the 1Million Project will get an additional 10GB of hotspot data per month, raising the total allotment to 20GB until June 30For more information visit https://newsroom.sprint.com/covid-19-updates-sprint-responds.htm

Beginning Monday, March 16, well offer two free months of internet and WiFi services to new customers in households with Pre-K to 12 or college students who need remote education. This discount will be applied as a credit for your first two months of internet services. Well waive any installation or pre-payment fees to help get you started. You can qualify for this offer if you: have a student of qualifying age at your service address with remote education needs have not subscribed to our internet services within the past 30 days. Call 1-855-243-8892 to sign up for this offer or visit

span.br: Customers currently on an unlimited data plan with Boost Mobile will automatically receive an additional 20 Gigs of mobile hotspot on their plans at no extra cost through April 30, 2020. No need to call care or update your account through boostmobile.com.

p.span: You will not see these extra Gigs added to your current Mobile Hotspot allotment. For information on how these additional Gigs will be allocated to your plan, please see the FAQ below.

Customers currently on a capped data plan with Boost Mobile will automatically receive an additional 20 Gigs of data on their plans at no extra cost through April 30, 2020. No need to call care or update your account through boostmobile.com. If you need an additional mobile hotspot to check out our rate plans that include mobile hotspot.
To learn more visit:

div.span: Download the FreeNixa Schools' District App

div.p: With the use of Community Economic Relief Fund. United Way may help with bills, rent, and food. Call 1-866-211-9966 and provide your zip code for a list of agencies who provide assistance.

p.span: Care to Learn focuses on meeting the emergent needs of students in the areas of health, hunger, and hygiene.
Care to Learn Nixa resource page,click here.
